metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11811 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.4. There is a use-after-free upon attempted read access to /proc/ioports after the ipmi_si module is removed, related to drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_intf.c, drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_mem_io.c, and drivers/char/ipmi/ipmi_si_port_io.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue requires an administrator or a privileged attacker to unload the impmi_si module before it can be triggered.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
